letters.description: Identify and define the specific ADHD-related challenges the client is facing in their daily life. This includes understanding the impact on various areas such as work, relationships, and self-esteem.
Collaboratively observe patterns and gather information about the client's routines, habits, and triggers. Organize the information to identify areas for improvement and create a structured approach.

Develop personalized, practical strategies and tools tailored to the client's unique needs and learning style. This may involve time management techniques, organizational systems, or mindfulness practices.
Identify and leverage the client's inherent strengths and talents to overcome challenges and build self-efficacy. Focus on positive reinforcement and building confidence.
Establish a long-term support system and develop strategies for maintaining progress and preventing relapse. This includes ongoing monitoring, adjustments to the plan, and celebrating successes.
